Extruded the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrude depth towards the normal of 0.0536 and an extrude depth opposite the normal of 0.0. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom.</description>

The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by adding four lines on the sketch: - Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.75 units towards the normal. Part 2: Cylindrical object with tapered top and bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.15, 0.15, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle on the sketch: - Center = [0.225, 0.225] - Radius = 0.225 4. Scale the sketch by 0.45. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Perform a cut extrusion with a depth of 0.75 units towards the normal on this 3D Sketch. This will create a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom.</description>
